name: Southeast Asian Culture and History [2] Multiple Choice Quiz | World | 10 Questions

questions.text: Men of which of the following places are most likely to take the 'haj' sometime in their life?
questions.explanation:
Java.

	Java is in Indonesia which is primarily an Islamic country.

questions.text: What term relates to the coastal areas of the Indonesian-Malay world in which Islam has been traditionally practiced?
What is the term for the brand of Islam practiced by the inland peoples of Java in which elements of animism, Hinduism and Buddhism are infused?
Which form of Islam of the Malayo-Indonesian world adheres strictly to the official observances of the religion?
Which of the following words is not a term for an official of Islam?
questions.explanation:
pondok.

	Pondok is a term for a community of Islamic scholars.

questions.text: What did the Spaniards call the peasants of the Philippines?
What is the English derivation from the Malay approximation of the Amoy (a southern Chinese dialect) pronunciation of the Chinese word for ship (chuan)?
Three of the following were destinations for the biannual Spanish galleon trade that ran during the Philippine colonial area. Which was not a stop on this triangle trade?
questions.explanation:
Cordoba.

	The galleon trade occurred on the Pacific and went from Mexico to China via the Philippines.

questions.text: Which of the following was the acronym for the 'Dutch East India Company'?
questions.explanation:
VOC.

	The initials stood for the Dutch name "Vereenigde Oostindische Compagnie".
